original:
The concept of ephemeral beauty in art has been a subject of speculation throughout history. The transient nature of such expressions raises questions about their value and significance. The discussion of ephemeral beauty can be traced back to ancient philosophical thought.

Plato posited that beautiful things are not enduring, asserting that true beauty exists only in the realm of ideals. For him, the "idea of the beautiful" represents
